overview: We‚Äôve improved the GitHub Projects onboarding flow to help you get started faster, with options to connect and import items from a repository, set a default repository for new issues, use new default workflows to set up your project, and more.

detailed_explanation.title: Overview
bullets: We‚Äôve improved the GitHub Projects onboarding flow to help you get started faster, with options to connect and import items from a repository, set a default repository for new issues, use new default workflows to set up your project, and more.

detailed_explanation.title: üöÄ Key improvements
bullets: During onboarding, you can now choose to import open issues, open pull requests, or both from a specified repository. The selected items are automatically imported when the project is created, so you can start with your existing content right away.
In project settings, you can now select a default repository. All new issues created in this project will be automatically associated with the selected repository.
Pull request linked to issue workflow
A new default workflow, Pull request linked to issue , automatically sets the status of an issue to ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äù whenever a linked pull request exists.

detailed_explanation.title: üõ† Additional onboarding improvements
bullets: New projects now show linked pull requests and sub-issues as default fields.
The Team planning template now defaults to Table view instead of Board view.
Insights and Workflows buttons have been elevated in the UI for easier discovery.
Polishing and minor fixes to make onboarding smoother and more reliable.

detailed_explanation.title: ü§ñ API improvements
bullets: We‚Äôve made improvements to the Projects GraphQL API making it easier to automate your project workflows.

You‚Äôll now see project_v2_item_status_changed , added_to_project_v2 , removed_from_project_v2 , and converted_from_draft events. These events allow you to understand information such as how long an item was ‚ÄúIn progress‚Äù before moving to ‚ÄúDone‚Äù.
You can filter project items using the query argument with any project filter. Check out the ProjectsV2 GraphQL documentation for more details.

detailed_explanation.title: ‚úç Tell us what you think!
bullets: Join the conversation in the GitHub Community , or select Give feedback from the project ‚Ä¶ menu to share your thoughts.

You can filter project items using the query argument with any project filter. Check out the ProjectsV2 GraphQL documentation for more details.
